history.content:
Not sure about 168 but I can answer for 161.

There's usually 3 projects for 161, the first being on stack smashing and buffer overflows in C, a secure database one in python, and a third one that has to do with networking. You can have partners for these projects. There's 3-4 homeworks in 161 but no quizzes.

Homeworks don't take too long, especially if you go to office hours which is helpful. As for projects, it really depends, but I've never had to go over any deadlines for them.

children.subject: Oh wow thank you. So there's basically nothing but lecture content for 95% of the class? 5-20 hours for 3 projects is basically 3 days worth of work.

Outside of actually attending lecture and discussions, I think I spent roughly 40% of my time in that class on projects and 60% on studying for the midterm and final. And the projects were 45% of the grade, which was nice. I should also mention that Shenker had a rule that you must participate (in either lecture or OH) at least once throughout the semester in order to pass the class.

By the way, I also took 161 and I can say that the homeworks are relatively short (maybe 5-10 hrs each (depending on how much time you want to invest to make sure your answers are correct) and only 3 full homeworks the entire semester). And projects 1 and 3 are not too bad, but project 2 can be quite long, so definitely try to start and finish that one as early as possible. Many students had trouble with the second project (it was a three part project and I got destroyed on part 1 but redeemed myself in parts 2 and 3, while for most people it was the other way around). My advice is to go through the slides / to OH before starting to make sure you fully understand the details of symmetric/asymmetric cryptography, because project 2 is graded on security, not functionality (and you are only given functionality tests to test locally).
If 168 projects are being revamped, I'm not sure how helpful this will be, but last Fall there were 3 relatively light projects (5-20 hours each and no partners), 1 midterm, and a final.

history.content:
Professor Shenker said the 168 projects will be "revampled". I'm not sure if this means more difficult, or simply changed for the better.

a. How many quizzes/hw/projects are for 168 and 161? Can we have partners?

b. How long does each take on average?

I plan on taking 61c, 161, and 168 next semester.
history.subject: CS 168 + 161 Projects
